elements.title: 2011 Vancouver Stanley Cup riot (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the 2011 Vancouver Stanley Cup riot (rioter pictured) was the second time a riot broke out in Vancouver after a Stanley Cup loss?

elements.title: cozy games (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Animal Crossing: New Horizons sparked a boom in the popularity of cozy games?

elements.title: Miyuki Ichijo (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that before becoming a voice actress, Miyuki Ichijo left the NHK music variety show Stage 101 in protest over the removal of its director?

elements.title: Akure–Benin War (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the 1818 Akure–Benin War led to the Akure Kingdom becoming a vassal state of the Benin Kingdom?

elements.title: Albert Gumble (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Albert Gumble and Owen Murphy's music score for the Broadway musical Red Pepper was dismissed by one critic as not "real music" because of its embrace of jazz?

elements.title: was the first to produce (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the 1994 Pacific hurricane season was the first to produce three hurricanes that attained Category 5 intensity, the highest rating on the Saffir–Simpson scale?

elements.title: To See the Next Part of the Dream (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the vocals of To See the Next Part of the Dream were recorded on a Samsung Galaxy S5?

elements.title: Paul Huff Parkway (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Paul Huff Parkway is named after a U.S. Army soldier who won the Medal of Honor while serving in World War II?

elements.title: Jenna Ortega (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Jenna Ortega almost quit acting to play soccer?
